choices.name: Get started with research for your Louisiana ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for Louisiana ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for Louisiana research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Louisiana research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Louisiana Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Get an overview of Louisiana research in this video.

    ☆ FS—Louisiana Overview—6:35

  3. Follow this research study for Louisiana ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Louisiana Research, 1880-Present

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for Louisiana research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Louisiana Resources
    ☆ AC—Louisiana State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  5. Record Finder: Use the Louisiana Record Selection Table to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Louisiana Record Selection Table

    6. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
    4. Learn about colonial records in Louisiana.

      ☆ AC—Colonial Records of Louisiana

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Louisiana in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Louisiana

    2. Learn about African American records in this article.

      ☆ AG—Louisiana African American Records

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for Louisiana.
    4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Louisiana in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Louisiana


Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  4. Learn about colonial records in Louisiana.

    ☆ AC—Colonial Records of Louisiana
Ethnic
  1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Louisiana in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Louisiana

  2. Learn about African American records in this article.

    ☆ AG—Louisiana African American Records

  3. Explore the African American Gateway for Louisiana.
  4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Louisiana in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Louisiana

1. Explore Louisiana historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Louisiana History

  2. Explore Louisiana history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Louisiana

  3. Learn about Louisiana history on InfoPlease.com.

    ☆ Louisiana History

choices.name: Learn about Louisiana archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Louisiana archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Louisiana Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Louisiana State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Louisiana.
  3. Explore the Louisiana Digital Library site for Louisiana.
  4. Explore the Louisiana State Library site.
  5. Explore Louisiana Dept. of Archives collection.
  6. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Louisiana genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  7. Search for ☆free online books on Louisiana research on the FamilySearch site.
  8. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.content:
• Explore city and county directories to find Louisiana ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city and directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Louisiana city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Louisiana Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Louisiana city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Louisiana city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Louisiana ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Louisiana city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

choices.name: Explore Louisiana obituaries and death records.

hidden.content:
• Find obituaries, for Louisiana ancestors.
  • Find death records and death indexes for Louisiana ancestors.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for obituary and death records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Explore the ObituariesHelp site for Louisiana obituaries.
  2. Explore The Ancestor Hunt for obituaries.
  3. Search for obituaries by county on the Newspaperobituaries.net site.
  4. Find additional resources for Louisiana obituaries on the ☆Linkpendium site.
Louisiana Death Records
  1. Learn how to find Louisiana death records in this article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: How to Find Louisiana Death Records

  2. Explore the Ancestors at Rest site for Louisiana death records.
  3. Explore Louisiana death records, indexes, and obituaries.
  4. Explore additional links for Louisiana death records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

QUIKLinks

choices.name: Learn about Louisiana maps and gazetteers.

hidden.content:
• Learn about the history of Louisiana maps.
  • Find out how Louisiana gazetteers can help you in your research.

content.text:
1. Learn about Louisiana maps in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Louisiana Maps
    ☆ AC—Wiki: Louisiana Maps

  2. Learn about Louisiana gazetteers in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Louisiana Gazetteers

  3. Access interactive maps and atlases of Louisiana on the ☆MapsofUS site.
  4. Find Louisiana towns and communities on the RoadsideThoughts site.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for maps and gazetteers. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Explore the ☆David Rumsey collection of Louisiana maps.
  2. Explore the ☆Perry-Castaneda site for maps of Louisiana.
  3. Explore historical Louisiana maps on the Historic Map Works site.
  4. Explore the ☆Old Maps Online site for Louisiana maps.

hidden.content:
• Find research clues in the Library of Congress historical newspaper collection.
  • Search Louisiana online newspaper sites.

content.text:
1. Learn about Louisiana newspapers in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Louisiana Newspapers
    ☆ AC—Wiki: Louisiana Periodicals, Newspapers, and Manuscripts

  2. Learn about researching historical Louisiana newspapers in this tutorial from The Ancestor Hunt.

    ☆ Research Free Historical Louisiana Newspapers—13:14

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for newspaper records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Search for ☆Louisiana historical newspapers in the Library of Congress collection.
  2. Find links to Louisiana newspapers on the Wikipedia site.
  3. Search the Louisiana Online Historical Newspapers site.
  4. Explore Louisiana newspaper resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  5. See additional Louisiana newspaper resources on the Linkpendium site.
  6. Explore additional links for Louisiana newspapers and obituaries on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Louisiana County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Louisiana.

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Louisiana Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.
  3. Explore records in the Afro-Louisiana History and Genealogy page.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Louisiana Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Louisiana Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Louisiana Genealogy - Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. South Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Louisiana.

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Louisiana research.
  2. Explore the Louisiana research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Louisiana research.
  4. Explore Louisiana research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Louisiana in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Louisiana Societies

  2. Explore the Louisiana Genealogical and Historical Society site.
  3. Explore Louisiana genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  4. Get help at a family history center in Louisiana.
